result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose J. Figueroa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------------

Enroll in an HSED or GED program to earn a high school credential. 
------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs except with a valid prescription and must be taken in accordance with the terms of the prescription. 
------------------------------------

Lifetime registration as a sex offender.
----------------------------------
Participate in any other counseling that Agent believe is appropriate. 
----------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------------------
Participate in sex offender treatment.  Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment.

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 08/10/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose J. Figueroa

defendant.name: Figueroa, Jose J.
defendant.address: W3764 Lakeview Dr, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jose J. Figueroa
Current: W3764 Lakeview Dr, Lake Geneva, WI 53147 United States  (Effective: 04-10-2017)
Prior: 406 N Wisconsin St, Elkhorn, WI 53121

10:07 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose J. Figueroa in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.   
Matter is on the court for sentencing.  
Court makes record as to the charge and maximum potentional penalty.  Court has reviewed the contents of the file including the PSI and Risk Assessment provided by Dr. Westendorf.  
Atty Johnson indicates that the victim has not submitted any information to their office.  They have had contact with the victim's mother.  
Atty Frost has reviewed the PSI with Mr. Figueroa and makes note as to a correction.  Mr. Figueroa gives further clarification as to statements by Agent in the PSI. 
10:16 am  As part of plea agreement, the State is not making a specific sentencing recommendation but will be making comments.  Atty Johnson would like to hear tthe testimony of Dr. Westendorf first.  
10:12 am  Dr. Melissa Westendorf is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Frost.  
10:24 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
10:27 am  Court takes short break.  
10:32 am  Court in session.  Atty Johnson provides the Court with additional information.  
10:40 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Frost.  
10:53 am  Statement by deft.  
10:58 am  Response by deft to Court's questions.  
11:00 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the deft.  

SENTENCE:  Sentence withheld - 10 years probation; One (1) day deadtime if revoked
CONDITIONS:
1)  Six (6) months in the WCJ with work release privileges to commence on or before August 10, 2016.    
2)  Participate in sex offender treatment.   
3)  Participate in any other counseling that Agent believes is appropriate.  
4)  No contact with victim.   
5)  No alcohol.  No drugs except with a valid prescription and must be taken in accordance with the terms of the prescription.  
6)  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment that is needed.  
7)  Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment.  
8)  Enroll in an HSED or GED program to earn a high school credential.  
9)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
10)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
11)  Lifetime registration as a sex offender.  
 Court gives Deft warnings with regard to 1) firearm possession; 2) voting ineligibility; 3) Poss. of body armor; 4) Child offender working with children;  11:29 am  Court in recess.
Defendant's
Sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose J. Figueroa in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

MUST POST $1,000.00 CASH

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.C.E., D.O.B. 01/19/2000 OR HIS RESIDENCE IN BELOIT.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
